name: postcss-safe-parser
readme: # PostCSS Safe Parser [![Build Status][ci-img]][ci] A fault-tolerant CSS parser for [PostCSS], which will find & fix syntax errors, capable of parsing any input. It is useful for: * Parse legacy code with many hacks. For example, it can parse all examples from [Browserhacks]. * Works with demo tools with live input like [Autoprefixer demo]. [Autoprefixer demo]: http://simevidas.jsbin.com/gufoko/quiet [Browserhacks]: http://browserhacks.com/ [PostCSS]: https://github.com/postcss/postcss [ci-img]: https://img.shields.io/travis/postcss/postcss-safe-parser.svg [ci]: https://travis-ci.org/postcss/postcss-safe-parser ## Usage ```js var safe = require('postcss-safe-parser'); var badCss = 'a {'; postcss(plugins).process(badCss, { parser: safe }).then(function (result) { result.css //= 'a {}' }); ```
